original: I am going home with my brother.
translated: Je rentre chez moi avec mon frère.

original: He begged me to go with him.
translated: Il m'a supplié d'y aller avec lui.

original: I gained three pounds.

original: We can get there by underground.

original: They have already finished the work.

original: She laid her baby on the bed.
translated: Elle mit au lit son bébé.

original: I don't use my bicycle very often.
translated: Je n'utilise pas mon vélo très souvent.

original: He decided to submit his resignation.
translated: Il a décidé de soumettre sa démission.

original: We were a little tired.

original: You're not the only Canadian here.

original: Call the police!

original: I have been told that I am pragmatic, and I am.
translated: On m'a dit que je suis pragmatique, et je le suis.

original: You may invite any person you like.

original: I wasn't invited to the opening ceremony.
translated: Je n'ai pas été invité à la cérémonie d'ouverture.

original: Don't forget to take your pills.

original: I am determined to be a scientist.

original: Mary is thirty years old, isn't she?
translated: Mary a trente ans, n'est-ce pas ?

original: I have three weeks of vacation.
translated: J'ai trois semaines de vacances.

original: Tom doesn't know where to go.
translated: Tom ne sait pas où aller.

original: I have not been to New Zealand.
translated: Je n'ai jamais été en Nouvelle-Zélande.

original: By chance I met my ex-girlfriend in Portugal.
translated: J'ai rencontré par hasard mon ex-petite amie au Portugal.

original: Have you ever heard of a poet by the name of Tom?
translated: Avez-vous déjà entendu parler d'un poète qui s'appelle Tom ?

original: I have a bad stiff neck.

original: My father drives a very old car.
translated: Mon père conduit une très vieille voiture.

original: I've just gotten home and had dinner.

original: Can you guess what I have?

original: How did you vote on that matter?

original: Tom is as busy as Mary is.
translated: Tom est aussi occupé que Mary.

original: My boyfriend is crying.
translated: Mon petit ami est en train de pleurer.

original: The child falls asleep while eating.
translated: L'enfant s'endort en mangeant.

original: She was about to leave the house.
translated: Elle allait partir de la maison.

original: My name is Francesco.
translated: Je m'appelle Francesco.

original: I never asked you to do that.
translated: Je ne vous ai jamais demandé de faire cela.

original: Some things can't be forgotten.

original: Why not apply for that job?

original: You were jealous, weren't you?
translated: Vous étiez jalouse, n'est-ce pas ?

original: I've been teaching French for over 30 years.
translated: J'enseigne le français depuis plus de 30 ans.

original: Mathematics is difficult for me.

original: I don't know much about computers.
translated: Je ne m'y connais pas trop en ordinateurs.

original: You've got to answer the question.

original: They're fast.

original: You should spend what little time you have left with your friends.

original: His face was full of hate.

original: I have a lot to do today, so if you don't mind, I'd like to have this discussion at another time.
translated: J'ai beaucoup à faire aujourd'hui alors, si ça ne te dérange pas, j'aimerais avoir cette discussion une autre fois.

original: I don't have to study tonight.
translated: Je n’ai pas à étudier ce soir.

original: There's a missing comma.

original: The sunglasses made him look like an undercover policeman.
translated: Avec les lunettes de soleil, il avait l'air d'un policier en planque.

original: I could have won the race if I hadn't sprained my ankle.
translated: J'aurais pu gagner la course si je ne m'étais pas foulé la cheville.

original: It's one of the most dangerous cities in the world.
translated: C'est l'une des villes les plus dangereuses au monde.

original: We looked at each other.

original: This store enjoys a geographical advantage.
translated: Ce magasin est bien situé.

original: It's likely that it'll snow again tonight.

original: I could use a drink.
translated: J'aurais bien besoin d'un verre.

original: Were I you, I would not do such a thing.
translated: Si j'étais vous, je ne ferais pas une telle chose.

translated: Si je me vautre, quel est le pire qui puisse advenir ?

original: I think you're putting in too much sugar.
translated: Je pense que vous y mettez trop de sucre.

original: Do you have a house of your own?
translated: Disposez-vous de votre propre maison ?

original: We got off on the wrong foot.

original: I like that song.
translated: J'aime cette chanson.

original: What's your phone number?
translated: Quel est votre numéro de téléphone ?

original: You're annoying.

original: I help him.
translated: Je l'aide.

original: The cat is sitting on the table.
translated: Le chat se trouve sur la table.

original: You're ruthless.

original: I'm sorry about last night.
translated: Je suis désolée au sujet de la nuit dernière.

original: Australia is the largest country in the world without borders with any other country.
translated: L'Australie est le plus grand pays du monde à ne pas avoir de frontières avec un autre pays.

original: I am taking her out to dinner this evening.
translated: Je l'emmène dîner dehors, ce soir.

original: He deprived my little sister of all her toys.
translated: Il priva ma petite sœur de tous ses jouets.

original: Why are you surprised?
translated: Pourquoi es-tu surprise ?

original: I just have one question.

original: Sami chose an aisle seat.
translated: Sami a choisi une place côté couloir.

original: I'm going to be late for work.

original: It's our fault.
translated: C'est de notre faute.

original: A lot of wild animals died for lack of food.
translated: De nombreux animaux sauvages crevèrent par manque de nourriture.

original: Why are you so insolent?
translated: Pourquoi êtes-vous si insolente ?

original: By the time you realize I'm gone, I'll be miles away. Don't try to find me.
translated: Au moment où tu prendras conscience que je suis parti, je serai à des kilomètres. N'essaie pas de me trouver !

original: If you're missing the forest for the trees then you're failing to see the big picture.
translated: Si l'arbre t'empêche de voir la forêt, alors tu loupes l'essentiel.

original: Tom isn't the type of person who learns from his mistakes.
translated: Tom n'est pas le genre de personne qui apprend de ses erreurs.

original: Tom will start.

original: Herbalists are indispensable to botanists.
translated: Les herbiers sont des outils indispensables pour les botanistes.

original: I like beer.
translated: J'aime la bière.

original: The work is not finished yet.
translated: Le travail n'est pas encore terminé.

original: I can't swim across this river.
translated: Je ne peux pas traverser cette rivière à la nage.

original: Please be careful.
translated: Veuillez être prudent.

original: That's the most logical thing that should be done.
translated: C'est la chose la plus logique à faire.

original: Don't let anyone come near the fire.
translated: Ne laisse personne s'approcher du feu!

original: She visited the old man in the hospital every day but Sunday.
translated: Elle rendait visite au vieil homme à l’hôpital tous les jours sauf le dimanche.

original: It's necessary for you to make the best use of your time.
translated: Il vous est nécessaire d'utiliser le mieux possible votre temps.

original: I've never stopped loving you.
translated: Je n'ai jamais cessé de t'aimer.

original: I've been promoted.
translated: J'ai été promu.

original: Ask me, so that I may love you and your brothers.
translated: Demande-moi, que je puisse t'aimer ainsi que tes frères !

original: We must protect the children.
translated: Nous devons protéger les enfants.

original: There are some people who think it's a bad idea.
translated: Il y a des gens qui pensent que c'est une mauvaise idée.

original: Can you make yourself understood in Japanese?
translated: Parviens-tu à te faire comprendre en japonais ?

original: I think we need more water.
translated: Je pense qu'il nous faut davantage d'eau.

original: We can't exist without water.
translated: Nous ne pouvons pas exister sans eau.

original: It's true that we don't laugh every day.
translated: C’est vrai qu’on ne rigole pas tous les jours.

original: It won't happen again.
translated: Ça n'arrivera plus.

original: Not again!
translated: Pas encore !

original: He's my cousin.
translated: C'est mon cousin.

original: I tried to save her.
translated: J'ai essayé de la sauver.

original: In Chile they speak Spanish.
translated: Au Chili on parle l'espagnol.

original: A cat is not a person.
translated: Un chat n'est pas une personne.

original: Seeing that you're not surprised, I think you must have known.
translated: Vu que tu n'es pas surpris, je pense que tu étais au courant.

original: We tried to cheer him up.
translated: Nous avons essayé de le remonter.

original: When did you notice that?
translated: Quand l'as-tu remarqué ?

original: I miss her a lot.
translated: Elle me manque fort.

original: The problem is you're not Canadian.
translated: Le problème, c'est que vous n'êtes pas canadiennes.

original: I want a lot more.
translated: Je veux beaucoup plus.

original: We should go to the party.
translated: Nous devrions aller à la fête.

original: Go now.
translated: Vas-y maintenant.

original: The last time I was sick, I was bedridden for 4 days.
translated: La dernière fois que j'ai été malade, je suis resté alité pendant 4 jours.

original: I hear voices in my head.
translated: J'entends des voix dans ma tête.

original: There is no such thing, at this stage of the world’s history in America, as an independent press. You know it and I know it. There is not one of you who dare write your honest opinions, and if you did, you know beforehand that it would never appear in print. I am paid weekly for keeping my honest opinions out of the paper I am connected with. Others of you are paid similar salaries for similar things, and any of you who would be foolish as to write honest opinions would be out on the streets looking for another job. If I allowed my honest opinions to appear in one issue of my papers, before twenty-four hours my occupation would be gone. The business of the journalist is to destroy the truth, to lie outright, to pervert, to vilify, to fawn at the feet of Mammon, and to sell his country and his race for his daily bread. You know it and I know it, and what folly is this toasting an independent press? We are the jumping jacks, they pull the strings and we dance. Our talents, our possibilities and our lives are all the property of other men. We are intellectual prostitutes.
translated: Il n'y a pas, à ce stade de l'histoire mondiale aux États-Unis d'Amérique, de chose telle qu'une presse indépendante. Vous le savez et je le sais. Il n'y a pas un de vous qui ose écrire ses franches opinions, et si vous le faisiez, vous savez d'avance qu'elles ne seraient jamais publiées. Je suis hebdomadairement payé pour tenir mes franches opinions à distance du journal auquel je suis lié. D'autres d'entre vous reçoivent de mêmes émoluments pour des choses similaires, et n'importe lequel d'entre vous qui serait assez bête pour écrire de franches opinions serait à la rue à chercher un autre emploi. Si je laissais mes franches opinions être publiées dans l'une des parutions de mes journaux, mon emploi s'évaporerait avant vingt-quatre heures. Le boulot du journaliste est de détruire la vérité, de mentir effrontément, de pervertir, de diaboliser, de lécher les pieds de Mammon et de vendre son pays et sa race pour gagner son pain quotidien. Vous le savez et je le sais, et quelle folie est cette célébration d'une presse indépendante ? Nous sommes des pantins, ils tirent les ficelles et nous dansons. Nos talents, nos possibilités et nos vies sont tous la propriété d'autres hommes. Nous sommes des prostitués intellectuels.

original: You have a gift for music.
translated: Tu as un talent musical.

original: I made a couple calls.
translated: J'ai passé quelques coups de fil.

original: We're poor.
translated: Nous sommes pauvres.

original: The crashed plane burst into flames.
translated: L'avion, écrasé, s'embrasa soudainement.

original: I watched it on YouTube.

original: Grab hold of this.

original: Birch trees have white bark.
translated: Les bouleaux ont l'écorce blanche.

original: The sky has become overcast.

original: There must be a pattern.

original: Do you have small change?
translated: Avez-vous de la petite monnaie ?

original: I've tried calling him all day, but the line is busy.

original: I can't stop smoking.
translated: Je ne parviens pas à m'arrêter de fumer.

original: Sami put the key into his pocket.
translated: Sami mit la clé dans sa poche.

original: He runs a supermarket in the town.

original: If the life and death of Socrates are those of a wise man, the life and death of Jesus are those of a God.
translated: Si la vie et la mort de Socrate sont d'un sage, la vie et la mort de Jésus sont d'un Dieu.

original: He's safe here.

original: I always root for the underdog.

original: 'Sup, dude?

original: She drives a BMW.

original: I don't have as much money as you think.

original: I know that you aren't ready.

original: Penguins move gracefully in water and awkwardly on land.

original: Sami bought acid to destroy Layla's body.
translated: Sami a acheté de l'acide pour détruire le corps de Layla.

original: It was a resounding success.

original: Why should you be surprised?

original: I broke my arm.

original: I'd like to become a lawyer.

original: You can do whatever you want to.

original: I think it's time for us to come to an agreement.

original: Is there anything that makes your pain better?

original: I really, really need it.

original: Do you wear jeans to work?

original: Tom thinks that's true.

original: This machine can print sixty pages a minute.

original: Our technologies can record phenomena well outside the realm of human visual abilities.
translated: Nos technologies peuvent enregistrer des phénomènes bien au-delà du domaine des capacités visuelles humaines.

original: I've just watched a video on how to bake a sumptuous blueberry pie.

original: That's what's wrong with you.

original: I like to read books.

original: Shall we play cowboy and Indians? I declare myself a sheriff, and you all must obey me.
translated: On joue au cowboy et à l'Indien ? Je m'autoproclame shérif et vous devez tous m'obéir.

original: You don't have the habit of showing your feelings.

original: Specify.

original: I had to do it.

original: He is a teacher of English.

original: No matter how hard she tried, she couldn't please him.

original: There is no plan B.

original: We're looking for someone.

original: I appreciate the help.

original: We always like what we don't have.

original: He is a very serious person.

original: "Nice to meet you," said the businessman.

original: That'll be seven dollars, please.

original: I was aware of being watched.

original: I kept an eye on her suitcase.

original: I'm sorry.

original: That type of person almost never asks for a raise.

original: It doesn't matter to us if you take a photo from the outside.

original: You're not that old.

original: I'll do my best not to cause any trouble.

original: Why are they so upset?

original: Since he was dressed in black, he looked like a priest.
translated: Comme il était habillé de noir, il ressemblait à un prêtre.

original: Strictly speaking, this sentence is grammatically incorrect.
translated: À strictement parler, cette phrase n'est pas grammaticalement correcte.

original: I usually wake up at 6.
translated: Je me lève généralement à six heures.

original: That isn't an orange, either.

original: That's rubbish.

original: Tom is obese, isn't he?

original: He made his son attend the meeting in his place.

original: They hate us.

original: The accident resulted from his carelessness.

original: I can't afford a camera as good as yours.

original: Close that drawer.

original: Please be careful.

original: Let's smoke this hashish!

original: Is a question still a sentence?

original: We did not help him, so he made it by himself.

original: Sami's body was found.

original: An enormous bull charged at him.

original: I'm saving up to buy a new car.

original: They've bought some bread.

original: Why am I shooting these guys, tell me, what have they done?

original: You don't look like a doctor.

original: I've got tons of ideas. Good ones, not so much.

original: We sent you an email with an activation link.
translated: Nous vous avons fait parvenir un courriel contenant un lien d'activation.

original: I can't hear it.
translated: Je n'arrive pas à l'entendre.

original: I don't know when I'll do that.

original: Which is the hottest of all the seasons?

original: I washed the windows.
translated: J'ai lavé les fenêtres.

original: It looks like you just saw a ghost.

original: I will pick him up at the station.

original: Where's this train going?

original: Sprinkle the slices of goat's cheese with chopped walnuts and pistachios.
translated: Saupoudrez les tranches de chèvre de noix et pistaches hachées.

original: Have a nice flight.

original: Let him wait!

original: This plastic squirrel was made in China.

original: Their car overtook ours.

original: "What do you want?" "I want a dog."
translated: « Qu'est-ce que tu veux ? » « Je veux un chien. »

original: Something is wrong with this calculator.

original: She has red hair.

original: I have all these apples to carry, not to mention this bag of potatoes.

original: I love eggplant.

original: I don't have the money to buy that book.
translated: Je ne dispose pas de l'argent pour acheter ce livre.

original: We were outnumbered.
translated: Nous avons été surpassées en nombre.

original: I think you need help.
translated: Je pense que vous avez besoin d'aide.

original: Tom didn't really enjoy studying French.
translated: Tom n'a pas vraiment apprécié d'étudier le français.

original: I finally found a pair of shoes that fit.
translated: J'ai enfin trouvé une paire de chaussures qui me va.

original: He's incapable of seeing a pretty woman without immediately going to talk to her.
translated: Il est incapable d'apercevoir une jolie femme sans aller aussitôt lui parler.

original: Start reading where you left off.
translated: Commencez à lire là où vous vous êtes arrêtés.

original: Are all the windows shut?
translated: Toutes les fenêtres sont-elles fermées ?

original: I have no money to buy the dictionary.
translated: Je n'ai pas d'argent pour acheter le dictionnaire.

original: Have you ever cried because of a woman?
translated: As-tu déjà pleuré à cause d'une femme ?

original: I'm sitting alone in my house.
translated: Je suis assis seul dans ma maison.

original: We're a bit late.
translated: Nous sommes un tantinet en retard.

original: I don't want Tom to go to jail.
translated: Je ne veux pas que Tom aille en prison.

original: I cannot speak English, much less Spanish.
translated: Je ne sais pas parler anglais, et encore moins espagnol.

original: We are fleeing to Japan.
translated: Nous fuyons au Japon.

original: I had never seen a giraffe till I visited the zoo.
translated: Je n'avais jamais vu de girafe avant d'aller au zoo.

original: I wish to speak with you in private. Call me.
translated: Je veux te parler en privé. Téléphone-moi.

original: Do you have the painting?
translated: Détiens-tu le tableau ?

original: How do you intend to do it?
translated: Comment te proposes-tu de le faire ?

original: To deny sustenance to the Army of Northern Virginia, Sheridan determined to take the entire harvest of the Shenandoah Valley.
translated: Pour couper les vivres à l'armée de Virginie du Nord, Sheridan décida de prendre la totalité de la récolte de la vallée de Shenandoah.

original: Saying no to unequal language rights isn't the same thing as paranoia.
translated: Refuser l'iniquité linguistique, ce n'est pas être paranoïaque.

original: It's a beautiful picture.
translated: C'est un magnifique dessin.

original: My insurance broker sells both home and vehicle insurance but not life insurance.
translated: Mon courtier en assurances vend des assurances habitation et des assurances auto, mais pas d'assurance vie.

original: We're positive that they forgot to call us.
translated: Nous sommes sûrs qu'ils ont oublié de nous appeler.

original: If they want to participate they should tell him, not me.
translated: S'ils veulent participer, ils devraient le dire à lui, pas à moi.

original: I had a run of bad luck.
translated: J'ai eu une série de malchances.

original: Keep the window closed.
translated: Laisse la fenêtre fermée !

original: Tom and I are going to Boston next week.
translated: Tom et moi allons à Boston la semaine prochaine.

original: Mennad shot.
translated: Mennad a tiré.

original: Can you tell me why Tom isn't here?
translated: Peux-tu me dire pourquoi Tom n'est pas là ?

original: Show him how to do this.
translated: Montrez-lui comment faire !

original: Bees provide honey for us.
translated: Les abeilles nous fournissent du miel.

original: Sami, a gay teenager, came out to his mother.
translated: Sami, un adolescent gay, a fait son coming out à sa mère.

original: It is said that she is the best tennis player in France.
translated: On dit que c'est la meilleure joueuse de tennis de France.

original: The crew abandoned the ship.
translated: L'équipage a quitté le navire.

original: To do that, you have to get up earlier.
translated: Pour faire ça, tu dois te lever plus tôt.

original: Trust the bear!
translated: Fais confiance à l'ours !

original: I swim almost every day in the summer.
translated: Je nage presque tous les jours en été.

original: I have three cousins.
translated: J'ai trois cousins.

original: Try it once again.
translated: Essaie-le encore une fois.

original: Why do people kill themselves?
translated: Pourquoi les gens se suicident-ils ?

original: Focus on the details.
translated: Concentre-toi sur les détails.

original: I have cash.
translated: J'ai du liquide.

original: They'll have a blast.
translated: Ils vont s'éclater.

original: Yes, I did this intentionally.
translated: Oui, je l'ai fait exprès.

original: I didn't show anyone those pictures.
translated: Je n'ai montré ces photos à personne.

original: This isn't the time or the place to do that.
translated: Ce n'est ni le lieu ni l'endroit pour faire ça.

original: Whoever pitches, that team always loses.
translated: Qu'importe qui lance, cette équipe perd toujours.

original: I didn't give anything to her.
translated: Je ne lui ai rien donné.

original: I reached the hilltop exactly at five.
translated: Je suis arrivé au sommet à 5 heures précises.

original: You deserve to succeed.
translated: Vous méritez de réussir.

original: The modern conservative is engaged in one of man's oldest exercises in moral philosophy; that is, the search for a superior moral justification for selfishness.
translated: Le conservateur moderne se livre à l'un des plus anciens exercices de philosophie morale de l'homme, à savoir la recherche d'une justification hautement morale à l'égoïsme.

original: She opened the door.
translated: Elle a ouvert la porte.

original: He looks just like his father.
translated: Il ressemble exactement à son père.

original: I'm buying candy and cookies.
translated: J'achète des bonbons et des biscuits.

original: Do you have nightmares?
translated: Fais-tu des cauchemars ?

original: I try to leave room for dessert.
translated: J'essaie de me réserver pour le dessert.

original: I didn't want that job.
translated: Je ne voulais pas ce métier.

original: He was aware of the danger.
translated: Il était conscient du danger.

original: That turned out not to be so easy.
translated: Ça s'est révélé pas si facile que ça.

original: I like to make people happy.
translated: J'aime rendre les gens heureux.

original: I didn't even notice you.
translated: Je ne t'ai même pas remarqué.

original: We can live with that.
translated: Nous pouvons vivre avec ça.

original: This should only take a few more minutes.
translated: Ça ne devrait prendre que quelques minutes de plus.

original: He got away.
translated: Il a filé.

original: I must admit that it was my fault.
translated: Je dois admettre que c'était de ma faute.

original: We're here to help you.
translated: Nous sommes là pour t'aider.

original: Do you know this lady?
translated: Tu connais cette dame ?

original: Our teacher said that water boils at 100ºC.
translated: Notre professeur nous a dit que l'eau bouillait à 100 degrés celsius.

original: I think it'll rain today.
translated: Je pense qu'il va pleuvoir aujourd'hui.

original: Doesn't it sometimes just get to you?
translated: Est-ce que ça ne vous affecte simplement pas, parfois ?

original: All the boys didn't laugh at him.
translated: Tous les garçons ne se sont pas moqués de lui.

original: Without me, you wouldn't accomplish anything.
translated: Sans moi, vous n'accompliriez rien.

original: I don't agree with you.
translated: Je ne suis pas de ton avis.

original: They were welcoming the guests.
translated: Ils accueillaient les invités.

original: Take your coat off and make yourself at home.
translated: Ôtez votre manteau et faites comme chez vous.

original: You don't need to panic.
translated: Tu n'as pas besoin de paniquer.

original: Be sure to drop us a line as soon as you get to London.
translated: Pense à nous laisser un mot dès que tu arrives à Londres.

original: How long does she wish to stay in Brittany?
translated: Combien de temps souhaite-t-elle rester en Bretagne ?

original: She addressed herself to the chairperson.
translated: Elle s'adressa au président.

original: She liked the new dress.
translated: Elle aimait la nouvelle robe.

original: How come you're so slow?!
translated: Comment se fait-il que tu sois si lente ?!

original: We heard a gunshot.
translated: Nous entendîmes une détonation.

original: You underestimate Tom.
translated: Tu sous-estimes Tom.

original: Where did you see those women?
translated: Où as-tu vu ces femmes ?

original: Does this meet your expectations?
translated: Est-ce que cela répond à vos attentes ?

original: It took me a long time to get over my last relationship.
translated: Ça m'a pris beaucoup de temps de me remettre de ma dernière relation.

original: Translate this into French.
translated: Traduis ça en français.

original: I won't come if you invite them.
translated: Je ne viendrai pas si tu les invites.

original: Tom is going to have to ask Mary to help him.
translated: Tom va devoir demander à Mary de l'aider.

original: We are teaching you how to speak English.
translated: Nous vous apprenons à parler anglais.

original: Well, aren't you coming?
translated: Alors, tu ne viens pas ?

original: He had a son named Qian.
translated: Il a eu un fils nommé Qian.

original: Of course I understand.
translated: Bien sûr que je comprends.

original: You need to smile more.
translated: Tu as besoin de sourire plus.

original: It's fun to follow the path through the woods.
translated: Suivre le chemin qui va dans la forêt est une chose amusante.

original: A ruler can measure something up to twelve inches in length.
translated: Une règle peut mesurer jusqu'à douze pouces de longueur.

original: Are you accusing me of something?
translated: Êtes-vous en train de m'accuser de quelque chose ?

original: Tom often watches TV while eating dinner.
translated: Tom regarde souvent la télé en dînant.

original: I will explain to him until he understands.
translated: Je lui expliquerai jusqu'à ce qu'il comprenne.

original: I'll try that.
translated: Je tenterai ça.

original: Who likes beans?
translated: Qui aime les haricots ?

original: That isn't how I want things to be.
translated: Ce n'est pas la manière dont je veux que les choses soient.

original: It needs more salt.
translated: Il faut plus de sel.
